title: ISic001314. Funerary inscription for Myrtale
body:
Facsimile Images

Θ (εοῖς) Κ (αταχθονίοις) .
Μυρτάλη χρηστο-
τάτη, ἔζησεν ἔτη
λ, μῆν (ας) γ ∙ Κορνήλι-
5 ος Ἀγαθήμερος συν-
βίῳ εὐσεβεστάτῃ ❦
❦ ἐποίησε. ❦
Θ (εοῖς) Κ (αταχθονίοις) ·
Μυρτάλη χρηστο-
τάτη ἔζησεν ἔτη
λ, μῆν (ας) γ· Κορνήλι-
5 ος Ἀγαθήμερος συν-
βίῳ εὐσεβεστάτῃ ❦
❦ ἐποίησε. ❦

Apparatus criticus

English translation

To the gods of the underworld. Myrtale, most worthy, lived for 30 years, 3 months. Kornelios Agathemeros made this for his most devoted partner in life.

Italian translation

Agli dèi del mondo sotterraneo. Myrtale, degnissima, visse 30 anni e 3 mesi. Kornelios Agathemeros lo ha fatto per la sua devotissima compagna di vita.

commentary

This epitaph was found together with no.26, which was apparently erected in memory of the same man as set up this text (although it is also possible that they are father and son). The implication is that Myrtale was his first wife and that he remarried (to Euphrosyne) after her death. The differing letter forms and use of Greek numerals indicate that this was engraved by a different stonemason.

bibliography

  • 14.0492 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 111 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
  • 3.5717 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001252
